00027 function ajax_commments_ob_callback($buffer, $type) {
00028   global $ajax_comments_errors;
00029 
00030   // Catch non-errors (e.g. blank, redirect only)
00031   if (trim($buffer) == '') {
00032     return FALSE; // pass-through
00033   } else
00034 
00035   // Catch wp_die() WordPress Errors
00036   if (strpos($buffer, 'WordPress &rsaquo; Error') // if an error is present
00037       && preg_match('!<p>(.+?)</p>!is', $buffer, $errors)) { // parse it out
00038     $ajax_comments_errors[] = $errors[1]; // return plain-text error only
00039   } else
00040 
00041   // Catch unexpected WordPress Errors (e.g. custom plugin errors)
00042   if (trim($buffer) != '') {
00043     $ajax_comments_errors[] = ajax_comments_innertext($buffer);
00044   }
00045 
00046   return ''; // catch/filter everything
00047 }

00053 function ajax_comments_error_handler($errno, $message, $filename, $line) {
00054   // If the @ error suppression operator was used, error_reporting is temporarily set to 0
00055   if (error_reporting() == 0) {
00056     return;
00057   }
00058 
00059   if ($errno & (E_ALL ^ E_NOTICE)) {
00060     $types = array(1 => 'error', 2 => 'warning', 4 => 'parse error', 8 => 'notice', 16 => 'core error', 32 => 'core warning', 64 => 'compile error', 128 => 'compile warning', 256 => 'user error', 512 => 'user warning', 1024 => 'user notice', 2048 => 'strict warning');
00061     $entry = $types[$errno] .': '. $message .' in '. $filename .' on line '. $line .'.';
00062     global $ajax_comments_errors;
00063     $ajax_comments_errors[] = $entry;
00064   }
00065 }

00073 function ajax_comments_die($output) {
00074   status_header(200); // HTTP/1.0 200 OK
00075   // QUIRK: Normally we would return 200 to indicate success or 500 to indicate error. However,
00076   //        Opera 9.x will discard the contents of XMLHttpRequest.responseText unless it receives 200.
00077   //        Fortunately, jQuery.ajax will also recognize errors if the responseText does not match the specified jQuery.ajax.dataType.
00078   //        Therefore successions are passed in JSON and errors passed in plain text.
00079   @header('Content-Type: text/x-json; charset=utf-8', TRUE); // set content type to JSON
00080   die($output); // output to browser and die
00081 }

00095 function ajax_comments_shutdown() {
00096   global $comment, $commentdata;
00097 
00098   if (empty($comment) && !empty($commentdata)) { // before WP 2.0.10 - when $GLOBALS['comment'] was introduced
00099     global $wpdb;

00101   }
00102 
00103   ob_end_clean(); // stop buffering; which will trigger parsing of any prior wp_die() WordPress errors.
00104   // QUIRK: Depending on your PHP configuration, die() may or may not trigger ob_end_flush() when executed by wp_die().
00105   //        Therefore we explicitly stop output buffering above, in case it hasn't happened already.
00106 
00107   // Prepare a response for the XMLHTTPRequest object
00108   $options = get_option('ajax_comments_options'); // retrieve plugin settings
00109   $output = '{'. // prepare JSON object
00110     // Indicate entire template [flexible] or just one comment [conventional]
00111     '"comment_type":"'. ($options['performance'] = $options['performance'] == 'conventional'? 'conventional' : 'flexible') .'",'.
00112     // Provide selector for jQuery effect(s)
00113     '"comment_ID":'. ((int) $comment->comment_ID) .','.
00114     // Provide actual markup from current theme comments.php
00115     '"comments_template":'. ajax_comments_js_escape(ajax_comments_render_comments($comment, $options['performance'] == 'flexible'? TRUE : FALSE)) .
00116   '}';
00117 
00118   // Display caught errors, if any
00119   global $ajax_comments_errors;
00120   if ($n = count($ajax_comments_errors)) {
00121     ajax_comments_die(implode("<br />\n", $ajax_comments_errors), FALSE);
00122   }
00123 
00124   // If no errors present, assume successful comment insertion
00125   ajax_comments_die($output); // return new comment markup

00139 function ajax_comments_render_comments(&$comment, $entire_template = TRUE) {
00140   if (empty($comment)) return; // abort
00141 
00142   global $ajax_commments_post_ID;
00143   $ajax_commments_post_ID = $comment->comment_post_ID; // store for ajax_comments_request()
00144 
00145   // Prepare cookies for wp_get_current_commenter(), if necessary
00146   // Normally these would have been set during the post, and retrieved as the browser reloaded the page
00147   // But since we are using AJAX, we have to manually insert these into the $_COOKIES global variable the first time an anonymous user comments.
00148   // Required in order to display posts held for moderation.
00149   if (!$GLOBALS['user']->ID) { // only applies for non-logged-in users...
00150     $_COOKIE['comment_author_'.COOKIEHASH] = $comment->comment_author;
00151     $_COOKIE['comment_author_email_'.COOKIEHASH] = $comment->comment_author_email;
00152     $_COOKIE['comment_author_url_'.COOKIEHASH] = $comment->comment_author_url;
00153   }
00154 
00155   // Here we need to load all the variables normally present when visiting the single post page
00156   // The only good way to prepare all of them correctly is by using the WordPress API...
00157   ob_start(); // start buffering
00158   add_filter('request', 'ajax_comments_request'); // Like query_vars, but applied after "extra" and private query variables have been added.
00159   wp(); // generate necessary variables
00160   global $withcomments; $withcomments = TRUE;
00161   comments_template(); // render comments template
00162   remove_filter('request', 'ajax_comments_request');
00163   $output = ob_get_clean(); // get template, clear buffer, and end buffering
00164   unset($ajax_commments_post_ID);
00165 
00166   if ($entire_template) {
00167     return $output; // return entire comments.php template
00168   } else {
00169     // Parse important elements
00170     $wrapper_element = ajax_comments_parse_tag($output, array('id' => 'ajax_comments_wrapper'));
00171     $counter_element = ajax_comments_parse_tag($output, array('id' => 'comments'));
00172     $container_element = ajax_comments_parse_tag($output, array('class' => 'commentlist'));
00173     $comment_element = ajax_comments_parse_tag($output, array('id' => 'comment-'. $comment->comment_ID));
00174 
00175     // Return new comment only
00176     return $wrapper_element[0] . // wrap with <div id="ajax_comments_wrapper">
00177       implode("\n", (array) $counter_element) . // prepend with <h3 id="comments">
00178       $container_element[0] . // wrap with <ul class="commentlist">
00179         implode("\n", (array) $comment_element) . // single comment <li id="comment-1234"></li>
00180       $container_element[2] . // </ul>
00181     $wrapper_element[2]; // </div>
00182   }
00183 }

00206 function ajax_comments_parse_tag($haystack, $needle) {
00207   if (preg_match('`(<\s*([^>]+)\s[^>]*'. array_shift(array_keys($needle)) .'\s*=\s*[\'"]?'. array_shift($needle) .'[\'"]?[^>]*>)(.+?)(<\s*/\s*\2\s*>)`is', $haystack, $element)) {
00208     return array($element[1], $element[3], $element[4]); // return opening tag, atomic value, and closing tag
00209   }
00210   return FALSE; // not found
00211 }

00221 function ajax_comments_js_escape($variable) {
00222   switch (gettype($variable)) {
00223     case 'boolean':
00224       return $variable ? 'true' : 'false'; // Lowercase necessary!
00225     case 'integer':
00226     case 'double':
00227       return $variable;
00228     case 'resource':
00229     case 'string':
00230       return '"'. str_replace(array("\r", "\n", "<", ">", "&"),
00231                               array('\r', '\n', '\x3c', '\x3e', '\x26'),
00232                               addslashes($variable)) .'"';
00233     case 'array':
00234       // Arrays in JSON can't be associative. If the array is empty or if it
00235       // has sequential whole number keys starting with 0, it's not associative
00236       // so we can go ahead and convert it as an array.
00237       if (empty ($variable) || array_keys($variable) === range(0, sizeof($variable) - 1)) {
00238         $output = array();
00239         foreach ($variable as $v) {
00240           $output[] = drupal_to_js($v);
00241         }
00242         return '['. implode(', ', $output) .']';
00243       }
00244       // Otherwise, fall through to convert the array as an object.
00245     case 'object':
00246       $output = array();
00247       foreach ($variable as $k => $v) {
00248         $output[] = drupal_to_js(strval($k)) .':'. drupal_to_js($v);
00249       }
00250       return '{'. implode(', ', $output) .'}';
00251     default:
00252       return 'null';
00253   }
00254 }

00264 function ajax_comments_innertext($markup) {
00265   $text = preg_replace('`<\s*(head|title|style|script)(\s[^>]*)?>.*?<\s*/\s*\1\s*>`is', '', $markup); // strip head, title, style, and script tags
00266   $text = preg_replace('`\s+`', ' ', $text); // cleanup whitespace
00267   $text = preg_replace('`<br\s*/>`is', "\n", $text); // convert <BR /> to new line
00268   $text = preg_replace('`<[^>]*>`is', '', $text); // strip tags
00269   $text = trim(preg_replace('/ +/', ' ', $text)); // cleanup remaining space(s)
00270   return $text;
00271 }
